intro: Dalechampia decaryi var. mandrarensis, commonly known as the Madagascar chaffflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, spiky inflorescences and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by specialized bracts. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
